bearing_type.name: Bearing Type
bearing_type.description: The mechanical system allowing the tonearm to move freely.

categories.name: Gimbal
categories.description: A robust design using two pairs of bearings on perpendicular axes. Known for stability.

categories.name: Unipivot
categories.description: The arm balances on a single point. Known for a lively sound but can be harder to set up.

categories.name: Damped Unipivot
categories.description: A unipivot bearing that uses silicone fluid or magnets for added stability.

categories.name: Knife-Edge
categories.description: The arm rests on a sharp, hardened 'knife' edge. A classic low-friction design.

categories.name: V-Block
categories.description: A specific type of knife-edge bearing, common on vintage tonearms like Lenco.

categories.name: Dual-Pivot
categories.description: A hybrid design aiming for unipivot freedom with gimbal-like stability.

categories.name: Magnetic
categories.description: Uses magnetic levitation or stabilization for a non-contact pivot.

arm_material.name: Armtube Material
arm_material.description: The material of the main tonearm tube, balancing stiffness, mass, and damping.

categories.name: Composite
categories.description: Hybrid materials like carbon-wrapped aluminum or other layered constructions.

arm_shape.name: Armtube Shape
arm_shape.description: The general shape of the tonearm tube.

headshell_connector.name: Headshell Type
headshell_connector.description: The method for attaching the cartridge.

categories.name: Integrated
categories.description: A fixed, non-removable headshell for maximum rigidity.

categories.name: SME / Universal
categories.description: Standard bayonet connector (H-4) for easy swapping.

categories.name: P-Mount / T4P
categories.description: The standardized plug-in connector system for specific turntables.

categories.name: Proprietary
categories.description: A unique, manufacturer-specific connector.

tracking_method.name: Tracking Method
tracking_method.description: The fundamental way the tonearm tracks the record groove.

alignment_geometry.name: Alignment Geometry
alignment_geometry.description: The mathematical principle the tonearm is designed to follow.

vta_adjustment.name: VTA Adjustment
vta_adjustment.description: The method for adjusting the tonearm's height (Vertical Tracking Angle).

categories.name: On-the-fly
categories.description: Can be adjusted during playback via a tower or dial.

categories.name: Threaded Collar
categories.description: Height is adjusted by loosening a set screw and moving the arm pillar.

categories.name: Shims/Spacers
categories.description: Requires adding spacers at the tonearm base or under the cartridge.

azimuth_adjustment.name: Azimuth Adjustment
azimuth_adjustment.description: The method for rotating the cartridge to be perpendicular to the record.

categories.name: Adjustable
categories.description: The tonearm has a built-in mechanism for azimuth adjustment.

categories.name: Fixed
categories.description: The tonearm's azimuth is fixed and cannot be adjusted.

internal_wiring_material.name: Internal Wiring
internal_wiring_material.description: The conductor material used for the wiring inside the tonearm.

detachable_cable.name: Cable Connection
detachable_cable.description: Indicates if the external phono cable can be detached and replaced.

categories.name: Captive (Fixed)
categories.description: The external phono cable is permanently attached to the tonearm.

categories.name: 5-pin DIN
categories.description: Uses the standard 5-pin DIN connector at the arm base.

categories.name: RCA Jacks
categories.description: Features RCA output jacks directly on the tonearm or turntable.
